3e08c05780aa.bio: Author (as Anders Kermod) of A Falling Body, an ebook crime thriller. PhD on Andrew Marvell. https://plus.google.com/+ArtKavanaghAndersKermod
3e08c05780aa.name: Art Kavanagh

5289ca92da06.bio: Husband and father of 2. Made in England, grew up in Scotland, living in Australia. Ex-Entrepreneur, currently a UX Designer with Tabcorp in Sydney

paragraphs.text: 20. Shout out WYSIWYG while in a meeting
paragraphs.name: f70c
d373
paragraphs.text: 3. Mention how your General Assembly teacher was from San Fran, and that she worked on IBM’s super computer in the 70’s

paragraphs.name: 3e31
paragraphs.text: Boom! This makes you look like a ‘what’s under the hood’ kind of designer. You’re someone who wants to see the guts of a website. To go a step further resize to ipad and change something of the existing site , double boom!! Your colleague will leave your desk thinking you’re a bloody design wizard.

paragraphs.name: c9d4
paragraphs.text: 13. Look interesting & authentic by buying a fancy hipster coffee maker

paragraphs.name: f53f
paragraphs.text: The wifi here is terrible! This is some serious WYSIWYG, am I right? Need a competitive teardown on all that optionality for our next sprint. Now let’s park this framework and circle back on Slack.

paragraphs.name: 7fcf
paragraphs.text: I feel smarter already! ;)

661b5e65778.title: You have no idea, how critical №13 really is.

content.subtitle: Please excuse me I now must rotate my stock of artisan pickles.

paragraphs.text: You have no idea, how critical №13 really is. As an Asian dude, I wish I could grow my facial hair out so I can sport a handlebar mustache. If only so I could twirl the ends of said mustache while using №13.
